title: How to Naturally Depuff Your Face in the Morning (Quick Remedies)

steps.title: Cold water constricts blood vessels so your skin looks less puffy.
steps.content: Cold water constricts blood vessels so your skin looks less puffy. This can leave your skin with a more even, toned appearance. It may help you wake up, too! [1] X Expert Source Asmi Sanghvi, DO Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 16 August 2021. Just splash cold water on your face for about 60 seconds and gently pat your skin dry with a clean towel. [2] X Research source

steps.title: This stimulates blood circulation and reduce fluid retention.
steps.content: This stimulates blood circulation and reduce fluid retention. Apply moisturizer or face oil first, then use your fingertips to gently massage your skin in circular motions, moving upward and outward from the center of your face. Avoid vigorous rubbing since that can irritate your skin. [3] X Research source You probably already know that ice reduces swelling, but did you know that it can also reduce puffiness in your face? For even better results, cover a cube in thin cloth and perform your massage using your wrapped ice.

steps.title: Chill 2 spoons in the fridge for 15-30 minutes.
steps.content: Chill 2 spoons in the fridge for 15-30 minutes. Then, lie down and place the spoons over your eyes for 10-15 minutes. The cold directly on your eyelids should help reduce any swelling back to normal levels. [4] X Expert Source JoAnn Solomon Master Beauty Consultant & Celebrity Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 8 September 2020. If this is a recurring problem, keep the spoons in your fridge overnight. If you're in a hurry, wrap ice cubes in a clean towel and apply them to your eyes. You can also apply cold cucumber slices on puffy eyes. Some believe that cucumber contains additional nutrients good for skin, but there is a small risk of eye infection from bacteria on the vegetable's surface [5] X Expert Source JoAnn Solomon Master Beauty Consultant & Celebrity Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 8 September 2020.

steps.title: The warmth soothes your skin and relieves tension.
steps.content: The warmth soothes your skin and relieves tension. Steep green tea bags in hot water for 3-4 minutes. Wait 10-20 minutes until they're cool enough to touch. Then, place the bags over your eyes for 15-20 minutes. While cold is generally more effective for reducing swelling, heat can soothe sore areas and relieve tension. [6] X Expert Source JoAnn Solomon Master Beauty Consultant & Celebrity Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 8 September 2020. The caffeine constricts blood vessels which can also lessen the swelling. [7] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source

steps.title: If you tend to wake up dehydrated, that may be causing your puffy face.
steps.content: If you tend to wake up dehydrated, that may be causing your puffy face. Dehydration can make your eyes especially puffy! Downing 1 cup (240 mL) of water first thing in the morning can help rehydrate you and reduce swelling. [8] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: More moisture may be just what your skin needs.
steps.content: More moisture may be just what your skin needs. Moisturizer helps unpuff your face by increasing your skin's moisture barrier. [9] X Expert Source Asmi Sanghvi, DO Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 16 August 2021. The moisture barrier helps keep irritants and allergens from coming into contact with your skin, both of which can increase puffiness in your face. [10] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source To pick the right moisturizer for you, determine if your skin is normal (not too dry or too oily), dry (flaky or prone to itch), oily (prone to grease and frequent breakouts), sensitive (vulnerable to allergic reactions), or a combination (different parts of the face are dry and oily). [11] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Adults need to drink 11.5 to 15.5 cups (2.7 to 3.7 liters) of fluids a day.
steps.content: Adults need to drink 11.5 to 15.5 cups (2.7 to 3.7 liters) of fluids a day. You can avoid dehydration by drinking fluids (preferably water) every time you feel thirsty. Eating foods that contain a significant amount of water, like watermelon and spinach, can also help to hydrate you. [12] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Dehydration causes water retention, which leads to swelling. Avoid alcoholic beverages since they can dehydrate you. [13] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: That way, you aren't putting pressure on your face when you sleep.
steps.content: That way, you aren't putting pressure on your face when you sleep. If you don't want to give up your favorite sleeping position, switch to a softer pillow! A pillow without a lot of cushion can press against your face and cause it to swell. [14] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source For example, try a soft, conforming pillow made of down or feathers. [15] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source If you'd rather not use down, soft cotton or synthetic cotton works, too.

steps.title: This may improve circulation and decrease puffiness in your face.
steps.content: This may improve circulation and decrease puffiness in your face. Sleep on your back with another pillow under your head/neck at night. [16] X Expert Source Asmi Sanghvi, DO Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 16 August 2021. Be sure to raise your neck as well as your head! Sleeping with a bent neck can cause neck and back strain. [17] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Your body needs sleep to repair and restore itself each night.
steps.content: Your body needs sleep to repair and restore itself each night. Sleep helps reduce swelling in your face by stimulating collagen growth. Chronic sleep deprivation can also increase the production of the stress hormone cortisol. This hormone breaks down collagen, which you need to keep your skin looking smooth and firm. [18] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Most adults need 7-9 hours of sleep. Teens need 8-10 hours. [19] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Salt causes water retention, which can lead to swelling in your face.
steps.content: Salt causes water retention, which can lead to swelling in your face. Make sure you aren't exceeding your daily sodium limit and cut back if you do! [20] X Expert Source Asmi Sanghvi, DO Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 16 August 2021. The American Heart Association recommends each person get 2,300 milligrams a day (1 teaspoon). [21] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Replace salty foods like potato chips and French fries with healthier alternatives such as sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, and low-sodium pretzels.

steps.title: If only part of your face is swollen, keep an eye on it.
steps.content: If only part of your face is swollen, keep an eye on it. If it doesn't go away, or if it feels painful when you press on it, visit a doctor. This may be due to an allergic reaction, bug bite, or eye infection. Your doctor can treatment the underlying condition. [22] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source Swollen areas near the jaw are often caused by an infected tooth.
